required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of C-CAR066 in Subjects With r/r Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma Who Received CD19 CAR-T Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Study Evaluating Safety and Efficacy of CBM.CD20 CAR-T(C-CAR066) in Subjects With r/r Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma Who Received CD19 CAR-T Therapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

clinical_study.source: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, non-randomized and dose-escalation study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of C-CAR066 in treatment of r/r DLBCL who received CD19 CAR-T therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study plans to enroll 10 patients to assess the safety and efficacy of C-CAR066. Subjects who meet the eligibility criteria will receive a single dose of C-CAR066 injection.
The study will include the following sequential phases: Screening, Pre-Treatment (Cell Product Preparation, Lymphodepleting Chemotherapy), C-CAR066 infusion and Follow-up Visit.

primary_outcome.description: the incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 months after C-CAR066 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: the percentage of subjects who achieved complete response and partial response

other_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 months after C-CAR066 infusion
other_outcome.description: the percentage of subjects who achieved complete response

other_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 months after C-CAR066 infusion
up to 12 months after C-CAR066 infusion

other_outcome.description: time to death from any cause
duration of detectable C-CAR066 in vivo evaluate by qPCR

other_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 months after C-CAR066 infusion
other_outcome.description: duration of CD20+ B-cell aplasia post C-CAR066 infusion

arm_group.description: Autologous C-CAR066 (CD20-directed CAR T-cell) administered by intravenous (IV) infusion

intervention.description: Single infusion of C-CAR066 at a target dose of 1.0-9.0x 10^6 CAR+T cells/kg. Divided into three dose levels: low (1.0-3.0×10^6 CAR+T cells/kg), medium (3.0-6.0×10^6 CAR+T cells/kg) and high (6.0-9.0×10^6 CAR+T cells/kg).
